Cast: Gregory Hines, Billy Crystal, Jimmy Smits, Steven Bauer
Synopsis: Distinguished by a sharp, witty dialogue between its two cop protagonists, Ray and Danny (Gregory Hines and Billy Crystal), this...
Cnsensus: Running Scared struggles to strike a consistent balance between violent action and humor, but the chemistry between its well-matched leads keeps things entertaining.

Cast: Christian Bale, Emily Watson, Taye Diggs, Angus Macfadyen
Synopsis: In the nation of Libria, there is always peace among men. The rules of the Librian system are simple. If...
Cnsensus: Equilibrium is a reheated mishmash of other sci-fi movies.

Cast: Jet Li, Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Maggie Cheung, Daoming Chen
Synopsis: Hero is two-time Academy Award nominee Zhang Yimou's directorial attempt at exploring the concept of a Chinese hero. During the...
Cnsensus: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.

Cast: Patrick Swayze, Kelly Lynch, Sam Elliott, Ben Gazzara
Synopsis: Dalton (Swayze) is a true gentleman with a degree in philosophy from NYU. He also has a flip side -...
Cnsensus: Whether Road House is simply bad or so bad it's good depends largely on the audience's fondness for Swayze -- and tolerance for violently cheesy action.

Cast: Denzel Washington, Chris Pine, Rosario Dawson, Ethan Suplee
Synopsis: In this action thriller from director Tony Scott, rookie train operator Will (Chris Pine) and grizzled veteran engineer Frank (Denzel...
Cnsensus: As fast, loud, and relentless as the train at the center of the story, Unstoppable is perfect popcorn entertainment -- and director Tony Scott's best movie in years.

Cast: Richard Roundtree, Moses Gunn, Gwen Mitchell, Christopher St. John
Synopsis: Shaft, a highly successful film, spawned an industry of sequels and imitations. The daughter (Sherri Brewer) of Bumpy Jones (Moses...
Cnsensus: This is the man that would risk his neck for his brother, man. Can you dig it?

Cast: Ok-bin Kim, Kim Seo-hyung, Shin Ha-kyun, Bang Sung-jun
Synopsis: Since she was a little girl, Sook-hee was raised to be a deadly assassin. She gladly accepts the chance to...
Cnsensus: The Villainess offers enough pure kinetic thrills to satisfy genre enthusiasts -- and carve out a bloody niche for itself in modern Korean action cinema.

Cast: Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Roxanne Hart, Clancy Brown
Synopsis: Among humans for centuries, an immortal specie existed. Connor MacLeod is a member of this specie. Unaware of his powers,...
Cnsensus: People hate Highlander because it's cheesy, bombastic, and absurd. And people love it for the same reasons.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, William Atherton, Reginald VelJohnson
Synopsis: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in...
Cnsensus: It lacks the fresh thrills of its predecessor, but Die Hard 2 still works as an over-the-top -- and reasonably taut -- big-budget sequel, with plenty of set pieces to paper over the plot deficiencies.

Cast: Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Justin Bartha, Sean Bean
Synopsis: Benjamin Franklin Gates is a third generation treasure hunter. All his life, Gates has been searching for a treasure no...
Cnsensus: National Treasure is no treasure, but it's a fun ride for those who can forgive its highly improbable plot.

Cast: Tony Jaa, Petchtai Wongkamlao, Bongkoj Khongmalai, Bongkoo Kongmalai
Synopsis: Kham's life is turned upside down when an international mafia syndicate, based in Australia, captures his two beloved elephants and...
Cnsensus: Despite some impressive fight scenes, this trimmed-down version of the Thai action pic is an off-putting mix of scant plot, choppy editing, and confusing subtitles and dubbing.

Cast: Matilda Anna Ingrid Lutz, Kevin Janssens, Vincent Colombe, Guillaume Bouchède
Synopsis: Jen (fearlessly embodied by Matilda Lutz, Rings) is enjoying a romantic getaway with her wealthy boyfriend which is suddenly disrupted...
Cnsensus: Revenge slices and dices genre tropes, working within an exploitation framework while adding a timely -- yet never less than viscerally thrilling -- feminist spin.

Cast: Carlos Gallardo, Consuelo Gómez, Reinol Martinez, Peter Marquardt
Synopsis: Filmed in two weeks on a budget of 7,000 dollars, El Mariachi was one of the singular pleasures of the...
Cnsensus: Made on a shoestring budget, El Mariachi's story is not new. However, the movie has so much energy that it's thoroughly enjoyable.

Cast: Feng Hsu, Chun Shih, Pai Ying, Tien Peng
Synopsis: According to this drama, set in 14th-century China, a state-run secret police organization made life a living hell for anyone...
Cnsensus: A brilliantly directed feast for the eyes with an epic story to match, A Touch of Zen marks a groundbreaking achievement in the wuxia genre.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Anthony Edwards, Val Kilmer
Synopsis: Devil-may-care navy pilot Pete Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is sent to Miramar Naval Air Station for advanced training. Here he vies...
Cnsensus: Though it features some of the most memorable and electrifying aereial footage shot with an expert eye for action, Top Gun offers too little for non-adolescent viewers to chew on when its characters aren't in the air.

Cast: Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi
Synopsis: Former war hero Cameron Poe (Nicolas Cage) is sentenced to eight years in prison when he accidentally kills a man...
Cnsensus: Con Air won't win any awards for believability - and all involved seem cheerfully aware of it, making some of this blockbuster action outing's biggest flaws fairly easy to forgive.

Cast: Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren
Synopsis: The Expendables are back and this time it's personal... Barney Ross (Sylvester Stallone), Lee Christmas (Jason Statham), Yin Yang (Jet...
Cnsensus: Taut, violent, and suitably self-deprecating, The Expendables 2 gives classic action fans everything they can reasonably expect from a star-studded shoot-'em-up -- for better and for worse.

Cast: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo
Synopsis: Loosely adapted from the classic 1932 horror film starring Boris Karloff, The Mummy is set in Egypt, where over 3,000...
Cnsensus: It's difficult to make a persuasive argument for The Mummy as any kind of meaningful cinematic achievement, but it's undeniably fun to watch.

Cast: Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody
Synopsis: John and Jane Smith are an ordinary suburban couple with an ordinary, lifeless suburban marriage. But each of them has...
Cnsensus: Although this action-romance suffers from weak writing and one too many explosions, the chemistry generated by onscreen couple Pitt and Jolie is palpable enough to make this a thoroughly enjoyable summer action flick.

Cast: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Elizabeth Peña, Tom Wilkinson
Synopsis: Brett Ratner directed this action-comedy that found box-office success by teaming Chris Tucker with Jackie Chan -- performing his own...
Cnsensus: A kick-ass addition to the cop-buddy film genre.

Cast: Denzel Washington, Marton Csokas, Chloë Grace Moretz , David Harbour
Synopsis: In The Equalizer, Denzel Washington plays McCall, a man who believes he has put his mysterious past behind him and...
Cnsensus: The Equalizer is more stylishly violent than meaningful, but with Antoine Fuqua behind the cameras and Denzel Washington dispensing justice, it delivers.

Cast: Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr., Scarlett Johansson, Sebastian Stan
Synopsis: Marvel's "Captain America: Civil War" finds Steve Rogers leading the newly formed team of Avengers in their continued efforts to...
Cnsensus: Captain America: Civil War begins the next wave of Marvel movies with an action-packed superhero blockbuster boasting a decidedly non-cartoonish plot and the courage to explore thought-provoking themes.

Cast: Gary Oldman, Harrison Ford, Glenn Close, Wendy Crewson
Synopsis: In this action drama, Harrison Ford plays James Marshall, a onetime combat hero in the Vietnam War who is now...
Cnsensus: This late-period Harrison Ford actioner is full of palpable, if not entirely seamless, thrills.

Cast: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Leah Ayres, Donald Gibb, Norman Burton
Synopsis: U.S. soldier Frank Dux (Jean-Claude Van Damme) has come to Hong Kong to be accepted into the Kumite, a highly...
Cnsensus: This is where it all began for the Muscles from Brussels, but beyond Van Damme's athleticism, Bloodsport is a cliched, virtually plotless exercise in action movie recycling.

Cast: Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff, Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright
Synopsis: British director Stephen Norrington helmed this David S. Goyer adaptation of the Marvel Comics character created in 1973 by scripter...
Cnsensus: Though some may find the plot a bit lacking, Blade's action is fierce, plentiful, and appropriately stylish for a comic book adaptation.

Cast: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Téa Leoni, Tcheky Karyo
Synopsis: Former video director Michael Bay had his first big hit with this action comedy, which also returned producers Jerry Bruckheimer...
Cnsensus: Bad Boys stars Will Smith and Martin Lawrence have enjoyable chemistry; unfortunately, director Michael Bay too often drowns it out with set pieces and explosions in place of an actual story.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Jeremy Irons, Samuel L. Jackson, Graham Greene (II)
Synopsis: Bruce Willis returns as misfit cop John McClane in the third film in the Die Hard series. McClane has fallen...
Cnsensus: Die Hard with a Vengeance benefits from Bruce Willis and Samuel L. Jackson's barbed interplay, but clatters to a bombastic finish in a vain effort to cover for an overall lack of fresh ideas.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Conchita Alonso, Yaphet Kotto, Richard Dawson
Synopsis: An unjustly accused prisoner in 2019 is given a slim chance at freedom if he enters a battle-to-the-death on a...
Cnsensus: The Running Man is winking sci-fi satire with ridiculous clothes and workmanlike direction.

Cast: Chuck Norris, Henry Silva, Bert Remsen, Mike Genovese
Synopsis: Not to be confused with the 1960 film of the same name, this fast-paced karate action flick stars Chuck Norris,...
Cnsensus: No consensus yet.

Cast: Clive Owen, Paul Giamatti, Monica Bellucci, Stephen McHattie
Synopsis: A mysterious man delivers a baby during a shootout and is entrusted with protecting the child from criminals out to...
Cnsensus: As preposterous and over-the-top as Shoot 'Em Up may be, its humor and non-stop action make for a very enjoyable film.

Cast: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Efren Ramirez, Jose Pablo Cantillo
Synopsis: A one-time freelance hitman who was just attempting to turn his life around is forced to keep his heart pumping...
Cnsensus: Crank's assaultive style and gleeful depravity may turn off casual action fans, but audiences seeking a strong dose of adrenaline will be thrilled by Jason Statham's raucous race against mortality.

Cast: Danny Trejo, Robert De Niro, Jessica Alba, Cheech Marin
Synopsis: A blade-wielding ex-federale hides out as a day laborer when he is double-crossed by a corrupt senator. ...
Cnsensus: Machete is messy, violent, shallow, and tasteless -- and that's precisely the point of one of the summer's most cartoonishly enjoyable films.

Cast: Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Albert Brooks, Bryan Cranston
Synopsis: Ryan Gosling stars as a Los Angeles wheelman for hire, stunt driving for movie productions by day and steering getaway...
Cnsensus: With its hyper-stylized blend of violence, music, and striking imagery, Drive represents a fully realized vision of arthouse action.

Cast: Michael Keaton, Jack Nicholson, Kim Basinger, Robert Wuhl
Synopsis: Jack Nicholson is the Joker, who emerged from a horrible accident as a maniacal criminal. Michael Keaton is the Caped...
Cnsensus: An eerie, haunting spectacle, Batman succeeds as dark entertainment, even if Jack Nicholson's Joker too often overshadows the title character.

Cast: Steven Seagal, Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey, Erika Eleniak
Synopsis: Andrew Davis directed this exciting thriller starring Steven Seagal, sans ponytail, and featuring electric, over-the-top performances by Gary Busey and...
Cnsensus: A well-directed action thriller that makes the most of its confined setting, Under Siege marks a high point for early '90s action -- and its star's spotty filmography.

Cast: Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell
Synopsis: A group of intrepid humans attempts to save the Earth from vicious extraterrestrials in this extremely popular science-fiction adventure. Borrowing...
Cnsensus: The plot is thin and so is character development, but as a thrilling, spectacle-filled summer movie, Independence Day delivers.

Cast: Steve McQueen, Robert Vaughn, Jacqueline Bisset, Don Gordon
Synopsis: Robert L. Pike's crime novel Mute Witness makes the transition to the big screen in this film from director Peter...
Cnsensus: Steve McQueen is cool as ice in this thrilling police procedural that also happens to contain arguably the greatest movie car chase ever.

Cast: James McAvoy, Morgan Freeman, Angelina Jolie, Terence Stamp
Synopsis: Wesley's (James McAvoy) life is over - his pathetic old one, anyway... Fortunately, it is all because of a girl....
Cnsensus: Wanted is stylish, energetic popcorn fare with witty performances from Angelina Jolie (playing an expert assassin), James McAvoy, and Morgan Freeman that help to distract from its absurdly over-the-top plot.

Cast: Marlon Brando, Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Ned Beatty
Synopsis: Christopher Reeve as the Man of Steel in a big-budget epic with Oscar-winning effects. Marlon Brando, Margot Kidder, Gene Hackman,...
Cnsensus: Superman deftly blends humor and gravitas, taking advantage of the perfectly cast Christopher Reeve to craft a loving, nostalgic tribute to an American pop culture icon.

Cast: Robert De Niro, Jean Reno, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard
Synopsis: When an international team of former intelligence agents and Cold War warriors meet in a warehouse, their adventure of love,...
Cnsensus: Ronin earns comparisons to The French Connection with strong action, dynamic road chase scenes, and solid performances.

Cast: Roddy Piper, Keith David, Meg Foster, Peter Jason
Synopsis: A homeless drifter discovers a reason for the ever-widening gap between the rich and the poor: a conspiracy by non-human...
Cnsensus: A politically subversive blend of horror and sci fi, They Live is an underrated genre film from John Carpenter.

Synopsis: Producer Neal H. Moritz and writer Joe Gazzam team with Studio Canal for this remake of the 1993 mountain-climbing adventure...
Cnsensus: While it can't escape comparisons to the movies it borrows from, Cliffhanger is a tense, action-packed thriller and a showcase for the talents that made Sylvester Stallone a star.

Synopsis: Marvel Studios presents Marvel's The Avengers-the Super Hero team up of a lifetime, featuring iconic Marvel Super Heroes Iron Man,...
Cnsensus: Thanks to a script that emphasizes its heroes' humanity and a wealth of superpowered set pieces, The Avengers lives up to its hype and raises the bar for Marvel at the movies.

Cast: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Jim Broadbent, Steve Coogan
Synopsis: A top London cop who is so good at his job that he makes his fellow officers look like slackers...
Cnsensus: The brilliant minds behind Shaun of the Dead successfully take a shot at the buddy cop genre with Hot Fuzz. The result is a bitingly satiric and hugely entertaining parody.

Cast: Michael Beck, James Remar, Thomas G. Waites, Dorsey Wright
Synopsis: Walter Hill's hip, super-stylized action film unfurls in a dystopian near-future, when various gangs control New York City. Each gang...
Cnsensus: As violent as it is stylish, The Warriors is a thrilling piece of pulp filmmaking.

Cast: Casper Van Dien, Dina Meyer, Denise Richards, Jake Busey
Synopsis: Paul Verhoeven has fashioned a visually spectacular, morbidly funny comic book adventure that seems to merge the fresh-faced youths of...
Cnsensus: A fun movie...if you can accept the excessive gore and wooden acting.

Cast: Wagner Moura, André Mattos, Sandro Rocha, Maria Ribeiro
Synopsis: The sprawling slum that towers over Rio de Janeiro is one of the most dangerous places on Earth, and as...
Cnsensus: Elite Squad: The Enemy Within is a bleak, violent descent into the Brazilian underbelly, ripping into the favelas with unstoppable and kinetic force.

Cast: Keanu Reeves, Patrick Swayze, Gary Busey, Lori Petty
Synopsis: Kathryn Bigelow's fourth action film follows FBI agent Johnny Utah (Keanu Reeves) as he goes undercover to infiltrate a cache...
Cnsensus: Absurd, over-the-top, and often wildly entertaining, Point Break is here to show you that the human spirit is still alive.

Cast: Geena Davis, Samuel L. Jackson, Patrick Malahide, Craig Bierko
Synopsis: The comfortably drab life of a working mom becomes a nightmare when she finds herself pursued by an assassin who...
Cnsensus: Smart, sharp-witted, and fueled by enjoyably over-the-top action, The Long Kiss Goodnight makes up in impact what it lacks in consistent aim.

Cast: Dan Stevens, Leland Orser, Lance Reddick, Sheila Kelley
Synopsis: From the director of YOU'RE NEXT and featuring a standout, badass performance from Dan Stevens ("Downton Abbey"), comes THE GUEST:...
Cnsensus: Boasting enough intelligence to bolster its darkly violent thrills, The Guest offers another treat for genre fans from director Adam Wingard.

Cast: Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace, Famke Janssen, Xander Berkeley
Synopsis: An ex-soldier (Liam Neeson) traveling through Europe embarks on a frantic quest to rescue his daughter (Maggie Grace) after the...
Cnsensus: Taken is undeniably fun with slick action, but is largely a brainless exercise.

Cast: Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, David Wenham, Rodrigo Santoro
Synopsis: Sin City author Frank Miller's sweeping take on the historic Battle of Thermopylae comes to the screen courtesy of Dawn...
Cnsensus: A simple-minded but visually exciting experience, full of blood, violence, and ready-made movie quotes.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jamie Lee Curtis, Tom Arnold, Bill Paxton
Synopsis: Borrowing liberally from the French film La Totale, this is an action picture, domestic comedy, and political thriller rolled into...
Cnsensus: If it doesn't reach the heights of director James Cameron's and star Arnold Schwarzenegger's previous collaborations, True Lies still packs enough action and humor into its sometimes absurd plot to entertain.

Cast: Sylvester Stallone, Wesley Snipes, Sandra Bullock, Nigel Hawthorne
Synopsis: The plot of this action film begins in 1996, with Los Angeles in a violence-crazed conflagration. One of the LAPD's...
Cnsensus: A better-than-average sci-fi shoot-em-up with a satirical undercurrent, Demolition Man is bolstered by strong performances by Sylvester Stallone, Wesley Snipes, and Sandra Bullock.

Cast: Sharlto Copley, Danila Kozlovsky, Haley Bennett, Tim Roth
Synopsis: Strap in. Hardcore Henry is one of the most unflinchingly original wild-rides to hit the big screen in a long...
Cnsensus: Hardcore Henry seems poised to reinvent the action flick, but without a story or characters worth caring about, its first-person gimmick quickly loses its thrill.

Movie_Title: Police Story (Ging chaat goo si) (Police Force)
Cast: Jackie Chan, Brigitte Lin, Maggie Cheung, Cho Yuen
Synopsis: This was internationally famous Jackie Chan's breakthrough action film, the work that got him past the ethnic boundaries of Hong...
Cnsensus: Blending brilliant physical comedy with thrillingly choreographed set pieces, Police Story makes a persuasive case for Jackie Chan as one of the all-time genre greats.

Cast: Samuel Le Bihan, Vincent Cassel, Émilie Dequenne, Monica Bellucci
Synopsis: French legend has it that a creature known as the Beast of Gevaudan -- a huge, wolf-like monster -- was...
Cnsensus: Brotherhood of the Wolf mixes its genres with little logic, but the end result is wildly entertaining.

Cast: Taron Egerton, Colin Firth, Mark Hamill, Samuel L. Jackson
Synopsis: Based upon the acclaimed comic book and directed by Matthew Vaughn (Kick Ass, X-Men First Class), Kingsman: The Secret Service...
Cnsensus: Stylish, subversive, and above all fun, Kingsman: The Secret Service finds director Matthew Vaughn sending up the spy genre with gleeful abandon.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Ian Holm, Gary Oldman, Chris Tucker
Synopsis: Good and evil battle for the future of 23rd century Earth in this visually striking big-budget science fiction epic. In...
Cnsensus: Visually inventive and gleefully over the top, Luc Besson's The Fifth Element is a fantastic piece of pop sci-fi that never takes itself too seriously.

Cast: Kurt Russell, Kim Cattrall, Dennis Dun, James Hong
Synopsis: Playing in a manner that can be conservatively described as larger than life, Kurt Russell plays a macho truck driver...
Cnsensus: Brimming with energy and packed with humor, Big Trouble in Little China distills kung fu B-movies as affectionately as it subverts them.

Cast: Charlize Theron, James McAvoy, John Goodman, Til Schweiger
Synopsis: A high-stakes, global action-thriller that takes place in the city of Berlin, on the eve of the Wall's collapse and...
Cnsensus: Atomic Blonde gets enough mileage out of its stylish action sequences -- and ever-magnetic star -- to make up for a narrative that's somewhat less hard-hitting than its protagonist.

Cast: Jackie Chan, Anita Mui, Francoise Yip, Bill Tung
Synopsis: After years as a major star in most of the rest of the world, Jackie Chan finally broke through to...
Cnsensus: An entertaining Jackie Chan stunt-fest in which the impressive action sequences overcome the low production value and by-the-numbers plot.

Cast: Cyril Raffaelli, David Belle, Tony D'Amario, Bibi Naceri
Synopsis: A nuclear weapon has been stolen by the most powerful gang in Paris' treacherous, walled-in ghetto, and it's up to...
Cnsensus: A nonstop thrill ride, District B13's dizzying action sequences more than make up for any expository flaws.

Cast: Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, John Ashton, Lisa Eilbacher
Synopsis: What's that wisecracking young black guy (Eddie Murphy) in that beat-up Chevy Nova doing in lily-white Beverly Hills? He's Axel...
Cnsensus: The buddy cop movie continues its evolution unabated with this Eddie Murphy vehicle that's fast, furious, and funny.

Cast: Tony Jaa, Petchtai Wongkamlao, Petchthai Wongkamlao, Pumwaree Yodkamol
Synopsis: Exhilarating fight sequences highlight this action-packed martial-arts adventure about an orphan (Tony Jaa) who embarks on a quest to recover...
Cnsensus: While Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior may be no great shakes as a movie, critics are hailing the emergence of a new star in Tony Jaa, whose athletic performance is drawing comparisons with Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan, and Jet Li.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Jamie Foxx, Mark Ruffalo, Jada Pinkett Smith
Synopsis: A taxi driver is unexpectedly taken on the ride of his life in this stylish thriller from acclaimed director Michael...
Cnsensus: Driven by director Michael Mann's trademark visuals and a lean, villainous performance from Tom Cruise, Collateral is a stylish and compelling noir thriller.

Cast: Rongguang Yu, Donnie Yen, Jean Wang, Tsang Sze-Man
Synopsis: This kung fu classic weaving fact and myth earned a theatrical release in the U.S. from Miramax eight years after...
Cnsensus: Iron Monkey may not have the poetic lyricism of Crouching Tiger, it makes up for it in fun and energy.

Cast: Kurt Russell, Lee Van Cleef, Ernest Borgnine, Donald Pleasence
Synopsis: It's 1997 and Manhattan has been turned into a maximum security prison. When the United States president crash lands into...
Cnsensus: Featuring an atmospherically grimy futuristic metropolis, Escape from New York is a strange, entertaining jumble of thrilling action and oddball weirdness.

Cast: Aki Maeda, Ai Iwamura, Chiaki Kuriyama, Tatsuya Fujiwara
Synopsis: A long-unavailable underground hit that anticipated The Hunger Games novels by eight years, veteran director Fukasaku's epically violent, still-controversial and...
Cnsensus: Battle Royale is a controversial and violent parable of adolescence, heightening teenage melodrama with life-or-death stakes.

Cast: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Alfred Molina
Synopsis: Stan Lee's all-too-human superhero returns to the screen in this highly anticipated sequel to 2002's blockbuster hit Spider-Man. Peter Parker...
Cnsensus: Boasting an entertaining villain and deeper emotional focus, this is a nimble sequel that improves upon the original.

Cast: Koji Yakusho, Takayuki Yamada, Yusuke Iseya, Goro Inagaki
Synopsis: Cult director Takeshi Miike (Ichi the Killer, Audition) delivers a bravado period action film set at the end of Japan's...
Cnsensus: Takashi Miike's electric remake of Eiichi Kudo's 1963 period action film is a wild spectacle executed with killer, dizzying panache.

Cast: Yun-Fat Chow, Simon Yam, Ann Bridgewater, Anthony Wong
Synopsis: Another entry into the "cheer for the most likeable bad guy" series of Hong Kong action flicks, Full Contact tells...
Cnsensus: No consensus yet.

Movie_Title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Cast: Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, Denholm Elliott
Synopsis: The third installment in the Spielberg/Lucas Indiana Jones saga, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade evokes many of the thrills...
Cnsensus: Lighter and more comedic than its predecessor, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade returns the series to the brisk serial adventure of Raiders, while adding a dynamite double act between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery.

Cast: Stephen Chow, Wah Yuen, Shengyi Huang, Kwok-Kwan Chan
Synopsis: The work of international superstar Stephen Chow, Kung Fu Hustle is a humorous, special-effects-filled, action-packed martial arts epic set in...
Cnsensus: Kung Fu Hustle blends special effects, martial arts, and the Looney Toons to hilarious effect.

Cast: Yun-Fat Chow, Leslie Cheung, Lung Ti, Young Pao I
Synopsis: John Woo established himself as one of Hong Kong's premiere action directors with this ultra-hip, ultra-violent action classic. The film...
Cnsensus: No consensus yet.

Cast: Robert Downey Jr., Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow
Synopsis: Billionaire industrialist and genius inventor Tony Stark is kidnapped and forced to build a devastating weapon. Instead, using his intelligence...
Cnsensus: Powered by Robert Downey Jr.'s vibrant charm, Iron Man turbo-charges the superhero genre with a deft intelligence and infectious sense of fun.

Cast: Joe Taslim, Iko Uwais, Julie Estelle, Sunny Pang
Synopsis: The Night Comes For Us follows Ito (played by Joe Taslim), a former triad enforcer, and his mission to protect...
Cnsensus: A bloody thrill ride designed to test the limits of more squeamish viewers, The Night Comes for Us wields a stylishly violent, action-packed punch.

Cast: Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart, Boyd Holbrook, Stephen Merchant
Synopsis: It's 2029. Mutants are gone--or very nearly so. An isolated, despondent Logan is drinking his days away in a hideout...
Cnsensus: Hugh Jackman makes the most of his final outing as Wolverine with a gritty, nuanced performance in a violent but surprisingly thoughtful superhero action film that defies genre conventions.

Cast: Sean Connery, Gert Fröbe, Honor Blackman, Shirley Eaton
Synopsis: To many, the quintessential Bond film and a brilliant third entry in the series. Here Bond gets his Aston Martin,...
Cnsensus: Goldfinger is where James Bond as we know him comes into focus - it features one of 007's most famous lines ("A martini. Shaken, not stirred") and a wide range of gadgets that would become the series' trademark.

Cast: Austin Stoker, Darwin Joston, Gilbert De la Pena, Laurie Zimmer
Synopsis: Cops, secretaries, and prisoners stuck in a soon-to-be-shuttered L.A. police station fight off a horde of murderous gang members in...
Cnsensus: Lean, taut and compellingly gritty, John Carpenter's loose update of Rio Bravo ranks as a cult action classic and one of the filmmaker's best.

Cast: Gal Gadot, Chris Pine, Connie Nielsen, Robin Wright
Synopsis: An Amazon princess (Gal Gadot) finds her idyllic life on an island occupied only by female warriors interrupted when a...
Cnsensus: Thrilling, earnest, and buoyed by Gal Gadot's charismatic performance, Wonder Woman succeeds in spectacular fashion.

Cast: Bruce Lee, Miao Ker Hsiu, James Tien, Robert Baker
Synopsis: Bruce Lee stars as a martial arts expert who vows vengeance when his kung fu master is murdered. He discovers...
Cnsensus: No consensus yet.

Cast: Chris Evans, Samuel L. Jackson, Scarlett Johansson, Anthony Mackie
Synopsis: After being deemed unfit for military service, Steve Rogers volunteers for a top secret research project that turns him into...
Cnsensus: Suspenseful and politically astute, Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a superior entry in the Avengers canon and is sure to thrill Marvel diehards.

Cast: Choi Min-sik, Gang Hye-jeong, Yoo Ji-tae, Gang Hye-jung
Synopsis: South Korean filmmaker Park Chan-wook directed this violent and offbeat story of punishment and vengeance. Oh Dae-su (Choi Min-sik) is...
Cnsensus: Violent and definitely not for the squeamish, Park Chan-Wook's visceral Oldboy is a strange, powerful tale of revenge.

Cast: Gene Hackman, Fernando Rey, Roy Scheider, Marcel Bozzuffi
Synopsis: This gritty, fast-paced, and innovative police drama earned five Academy Awards, including Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay (written by Ernest...
Cnsensus: Realistic, fast-paced and uncommonly smart, The French Connection is bolstered by stellar performances by Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider, not to mention William Friedkin's thrilling production.

Cast: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jason Statham, Dwayne Johnson
Synopsis: Continuing the global exploits in the unstoppable franchise built on speed, Vin Diesel, Paul Walker and Dwayne Johnson lead the...
Cnsensus: Serving up a fresh round of over-the-top thrills while adding unexpected dramatic heft, Furious 7 keeps the franchise moving in more ways than one.

Cast: Tcheky Karyo, Anne Parillaud, Jeanne Moreau, Jean Reno
Synopsis: The serpentine plotline of Luc Besson's La Femme Nikita begins its 117-minute slither when punkish, psychotic, and drug-ridden Nikita (Anne...
Cnsensus: A zany out-of-control thriller that gives lead Anne Parillaud a big character arc and plenty of emotional room to work within.

Cast: Jackie Chan, Maggie Cheung, Kenneth Tsang Kong, Wah Yuen
Synopsis: A Hong Kong detective fights to stop a Chinese drug czar....
Cnsensus: Blending hand-to-hand combat with breathtaking stunts and slapstick comedy, Supercop reminds us why Jackie Chan is one of the world's great entertainers.

Cast: Clint Eastwood, Andrew Robinson, Harry Guardino, John Mitchum
Synopsis: "You've got to ask yourself a question: 'do I feel lucky?' Well, do ya, punk?" Dirty Harry provoked a critical...
Cnsensus: As tough and taciturn as its no-nonsense hero, Dirty Harry delivers a deceptively layered message without sacrificing an ounce of its solid action impact.

Movie_Title: Live Die Repeat: Edge of Tomorrow
Cast: Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Bill Paxton, Jonas Armstrong
Synopsis: The epic action of "Edge of Tomorrow" unfolds in a near future in which an alien race has hit the...
Cnsensus: Gripping, well-acted, funny, and clever, Edge of Tomorrow offers entertaining proof that Tom Cruise is still more than capable of shouldering the weight of a blockbuster action thriller.

Cast: Hugh Jackman, Ian McKellen, Halle Berry, Famke Janssen
Synopsis: When a failed assassination attempt occurs on the President's (Cotter Smith) life by the teleporting mutant Nightcrawler (Alan Cumming), it's...
Cnsensus: Tightly scripted, solidly acted, and impressively ambitious, X2: X-Men United is bigger and better than its predecessor -- and a benchmark for comic sequels in general.

Cast: Harrison Ford, Tommy Lee Jones, Sela Ward, Julianne Moore
Synopsis: This 1993 box-office smash partly adheres to the 1960s TV series on which it is based and partly goes off...
Cnsensus: Exhilarating and intense, this high-impact chase thriller is a model of taut and efficient formula filmmaking, and it features Harrison Ford at his frantic best.

Cast: Chadwick Boseman, Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong'o, Danai Gurira
Synopsis: "Black Panther" follows T'Challa who, after the events of "Captain America: Civil War," returns home to the isolated, technologically advanced...
Cnsensus: Black Panther elevates superhero cinema to thrilling new heights while telling one of the MCU's most absorbing stories -- and introducing some of its most fully realized characters.

Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio, Ken Watanabe, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Marion Cotillard
Synopsis: Visionary filmmaker Christopher Nolan (Memento, The Dark Knight) writes and directs this psychological sci-fi action film about a thief who...
Cnsensus: Smart, innovative, and thrilling, Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.

Cast: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan, Catherine McCormack
Synopsis: Mel Gibson, long-time heartthrob of the silver screen, came into his own as a director with Braveheart, an account of...
Cnsensus: Distractingly violent and historically dodgy, Mel Gibson's Braveheart justifies its epic length by delivering enough sweeping action, drama, and romance to match its ambition.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow
Synopsis: Based on a short story by the late Philip K. Dick, this science fiction-thriller reflects the writer's familiar preoccupation with...
Cnsensus: Thought-provoking and visceral, Steven Spielberg successfully combines high concept ideas and high octane action in this fast and febrile sci-fi thriller.

Cast: Robert Downey Jr., Mark Ruffalo, Scarlett Johansson, Chris Evans
Synopsis: The grave course of events set in motion by Thanos that wiped out half the universe and fractured the Avengers...
Cnsensus: Exciting, entertaining, and emotionally impactful, Avengers: Endgame does whatever it takes to deliver a satisfying finale to Marvel's epic Infinity Saga.

Cast: Karl Urban, Olivia Thirlby, Wood Harris, Lena Headey
Synopsis: The future America is an irradiated waste land. On its East Coast, running from Boston to Washington DC, lies Mega...
Cnsensus: Fueled by bombastic violence and impressive special effects, rooted in self-satire and deadpan humor, Dredd 3D does a remarkable job of capturing its source material's gritty spirit.

Cast: Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen
Synopsis: The best-selling suspense novel by late author Robert Ludlum comes to the screen for a second time, following a 1988...
Cnsensus: Expertly blending genre formula with bursts of unexpected wit, The Bourne Identity is an action thriller that delivers -- and then some.

Cast: Donnie Yen, Hiroyuki Ikeuchi, Simon Yam, Xiong Dailin
Synopsis: Wing Chun grandmaster Ip has an amazing wife, plenty of money, the most beautiful house in town, and a blossoming...
Cnsensus: At once beholden to the established conventions of the genre and delightfully subversive of them, Ip Man is one of the most exciting -- and refreshingly character-driven -- martial arts films in years.

Cast: John Travolta, Nicolas Cage, Joan Allen, Alessandro Nivola
Synopsis: The third of John Woo's American-made feature films, Face/Off stars John Travolta as Sean Archer, an FBI agent obsessed with...
Cnsensus: John Travolta and Nicolas Cage play cat-and-mouse (and literally play each other) against a beautifully stylized backdrop of typically elegant, over-the-top John Woo violence.

Movie_Title: To Live and Die in L.A.
Cast: William L. Petersen, Willem Dafoe, John Pankow, Debra Feuer
Synopsis: William Friedkin's crime thriller, based on a book by U.S. Secret Service agent Gerald Petievich, concerns an arrogant Secret Service...
Cnsensus: With coke fiends, car chases, and Wang Chung galore, To Live and Die in L.A. is perhaps the ultimate '80s action/thriller.

Cast: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Maggie Gyllenhaal
Synopsis: Christopher Nolan steps back into the director's chair for this sequel to Batman Begins, which finds the titular superhero coming...
Cnsensus: Dark, complex, and unforgettable, The Dark Knight succeeds not just as an entertaining comic book film, but as a richly thrilling crime saga.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg, Paula Patton
Synopsis: This is not just another mission. The IMF is shut down when it's implicated in a global terrorist bombing plot....
Cnsensus: Stylish, fast-paced, and loaded with gripping set pieces, the fourth Mission: Impossible is big-budget popcorn entertainment that really works.

Cast: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordana Brewster, Dwayne Johnson
Synopsis: Former cop Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) partners with ex-con Dom Toretto (Vin Diesel) on the opposite side of the law....
Cnsensus: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.

Cast: Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Darlene Love
Synopsis: L.A. cop Martin Riggs (Mel Gibson), whose wife has recently died, is a loose cannon with a seeming death wish....
Cnsensus: The most successful installment in a phenomenally successful series, Lethal Weapon helped redefine action movies for the 1980s and 1990s.

Cast: Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage, Ed Harris, Michael Biehn
Synopsis: The sophomore film from former music video and commercial director Michael Bay, this fast-paced action yarn featured rapid-fire editing, a...
Cnsensus: For visceral thrills, it can't be beat. Just don't expect The Rock to engage your brain.

Cast: Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox, Kurtwood Smith
Synopsis: In near-future Detroit, a murdered police officer is resurrected as an experimental crime-fighting cyborg named Robocop. Tormented by memories of...
Cnsensus: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.

Cast: Keanu Reeves, John Leguizamo, Bridget Moynahan, Thomas Sadoski
Synopsis: In this next chapter following the 2014 hit, legendary hitman John Wick (Keanu Reeves) is forced back out of retirement...
Cnsensus: John Wick: Chapter 2 does what a sequel should -- which in this case means doubling down on the non-stop, thrillingly choreographed action that made its predecessor so much fun.

Cast: Daniel Craig, Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench
Synopsis: James Bond's first 007 mission takes him to Madagascar, where he is to spy on a terrorist Mollaka. Not everything...
Cnsensus: Casino Royale disposes of the silliness and gadgetry that plagued recent James Bond outings, and Daniel Craig delivers what fans and critics have been waiting for: a caustic, haunted, intense reinvention of 007.

Cast: Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey, Lily James, Jon Bernthal
Synopsis: A talented, young getaway driver (Ansel Elgort) relies on the beat of his personal soundtrack to be the best in...
Cnsensus: Stylish, exciting, and fueled by a killer soundtrack, Baby Driver hits the road and it's gone -- proving fast-paced action movies can be smartly written without sacrificing thrills.

Movie_Title: Fist of Legend (Jing wu ying xiong)
Cast: Jet Li, Paul Chiang, Yasuaki Kurata, Shinobu Nakayama (II)
Synopsis: Jet Li stars in this historical Hong Kong action film, as Chen Zhen, a Chinese student in Japan in the...
Cnsensus: No consensus yet.

Cast: Yun-Fat Chow, Sally Yeh, Danny Lee, Kenneth Tsang
Synopsis: Chow Yun-Fat, director John Woo's favorite actor, stars as a professional assassin. The moral outrages of his employers lead Yun-Fat,...
Cnsensus: The Killer is another hard-boiled action flick from John Woo featuring eye-popping balletic violence and philosophical underpinnings.

Cast: Iko Uwais, Yahan Ruhian, Arifin Putra, Oka Antara
Synopsis: He thought it was over. After fighting his way out of a building filled with gangsters and madmen - a...
Cnsensus: Although its high-energy plot and over-the-top violence may play better with genre aficionados, The Raid 2 definitely delivers more of everything audiences loved about its predecessor.

Cast: Bruce Lee, John Saxon, Jim Kelly, Shih Kien
Synopsis: One of the most popular kung fu films ever, and perhaps the peak of the famed Bruce Lee's career, Enter...
Cnsensus: Badass to the max, Enter the Dragon is the ultimate kung-fu movie and fitting (if untimely) Bruce Lee swan song.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Alyssa Milano, Rae Dawn Chong, Dan Hedaya
Synopsis: Colonel Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is retired and living peaceably with his 10-year-old daughter (Alyssa Milano) when she is kidnapped by...
Cnsensus: The ultimate '80s Schwarzenegger movie, replete with a threadbare plot, outsized action, and endless one-liners.

Cast: Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Brian Dennehy, David Caruso
Synopsis: A former Green Beret must use all of the guerrilla tactics he learned in Vietnam to save himself after he...
Cnsensus: Much darker and more sensitive than the sequels it spawned, First Blood is a thrilling survival adventure that takes full advantage of Sylvester Stallone's acting skills.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg
Synopsis: With the IMF disbanded, and Ethan (Tom Cruise) out in the cold, the team now faces off against a network...
Cnsensus: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation continues the franchise's thrilling resurgence -- and proves that Tom Cruise remains an action star without equal.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Michael Biehn, Paul Winfield
Synopsis: A Cyborg has been sent from the future on a deadly mission, it has been programmed to kill a young...
Cnsensus: With its impressive action sequences, taut economic direction, and relentlessly fast pace, it's clear why The Terminator continues to be an influence on sci-fi and action flicks.

Cast: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen, Oliver Reed
Synopsis: A man robbed of his name and his dignity strives to win them back, and gain the freedom of his...
Cnsensus: Ridley Scott and an excellent cast successfully convey the intensity of Roman gladitorial combat as well as the political intrigue brewing beneath.

Cast: Uma Thurman, Lucy Liu, Vivica A. Fox, David Carradine
Synopsis: An entire wedding party is slaughtered during a dress rehearsal in a rural chapel: the pregnant woman in the blood-splattered...
Cnsensus: Kill Bill is admittedly little more than a stylish revenge thriller -- albeit one that benefits from a wildly inventive surfeit of style.

Cast: Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello
Synopsis: As visually stylish as it is graphically violent, this thriller directed by Luc Besson concerns Mathilda (Natalie Portman), a 12-year-old...
Cnsensus: Pivoting on the unusual relationship between seasoned hitman and his 12-year-old apprentice -- a breakout turn by young Natalie Portman -- Luc Besson's Léon is a stylish and oddly affecting thriller.

Cast: Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, Sandra Bullock, Joe Morton
Synopsis: If you don't think Speed is the fastest-moving adventure film ever made, we challenge you to find a faster one....
Cnsensus: A terrific popcorn thriller, Speed is taut, tense, and energetic, with outstanding performances from Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, and Sandra Bullock.

Movie_Title: The Legend of Drunken Master (Jui kuen II) (Drunken Fist II)
Director: Lau Kar-Leung, Chia-Liang Liu, Liu Chia-Liang
Cast: Jackie Chan, Siu Tin Yuen, Jang Lee Hwang, Kau Lam
Synopsis: Jackie Chan returns in one of his greatest roles in this action-comedy sequel to his 1978 Hong Kong blockbuster Drunken...
Cnsensus: Jackie Chan sends up some amazing and entertaining fight sequences in The Legend of Drunken Master.

Cast: Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist, Alfie Allen, Adrianne Palicki
Synopsis: An ex-hitman comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters that took everything from him. With New York City...
Cnsensus: Stylish, thrilling, and giddily kinetic, John Wick serves as a satisfying return to action for Keanu Reeves -- and what looks like it could be the first of a franchise.

Cast: Yun-Fat Chow, Michelle Yeoh, Ziyi Zhang, Chen Chang
Synopsis: Taiwanese filmmaker Ang Lee took a break from making Western period dramas to fashion this wild and woolly martial arts...
Cnsensus: The movie that catapulted Ang Lee into the ranks of upper echelon Hollywood filmmakers, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon features a deft mix of amazing martial arts battles, beautiful scenery, and tasteful drama.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo, Bill Duke
Synopsis: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger) has a code of honor which he will not violate, even when his life depends on it....
Cnsensus: Predator: Part sci-fi, part horror, part action -- all muscle.

Cast: Matt Damon, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Scott Glenn
Synopsis: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) races to solve the mystery of his past while being hunted by members of the very...
Cnsensus: The Bourne Ultimatum is an intelligent, finely tuned non-stop thrill ride. Another strong performance from Matt Damon and sharp camerawork from Paul Greengrass make this the finest installment of the Bourne trilogy.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin, Sharon Stone, Ronny Cox
Synopsis: In Paul Verhoeven's wild sci-fi action movie Total Recall, Arnold Schwarzenegger plays a 21st-century construction worker who discovers that his...
Cnsensus: Under Paul Verhoeven's frenetic direction, Total Recall is a fast-paced rush of violence, gore, and humor that never slacks.

Cast: Mel Gibson, Bruce Spence, Vernon Wells, Emil Minty
Synopsis: Director George Miller's follow-up to his own 1979 hit Mad Max is proof that not all sequels are inferior to...
Cnsensus: The Road Warrior is everything a bigger-budgeted Mad Max sequel with should be: bigger, faster, louder, but definitely not dumber.

Cast: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight
Synopsis: A successful career criminal considers getting out of the business after one last score, while an obsessive cop desperately tries...
Cnsensus: Though Al Pacino and Robert De Niro share but a handful of screen minutes together, Heat is an engrossing crime drama that draws compelling performances from its stars -- and confirms Michael Mann's mastery of the genre.

Cast: Iko Uwais, Joe Taslim, Doni Alamsyah, Yahan Ruhian
Synopsis: As a rookie member of an elite special-forces team, Rama (Iko Uwais) is instructed to hang back during a covert...
Cnsensus: No frills and all thrills, The Raid: Redemption is an inventive action film expertly paced and edited for maximum entertainment.

Cast: Tom Cruise, Henry Cavill, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg
Synopsis: The best intentions often come back to haunt you. MISSION: IMPOSSIBLE - FALLOUT finds Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) and his...
Cnsensus: Fast, sleek, and fun, Mission: Impossible - Fallout lives up to the "impossible" part of its name by setting yet another high mark for insane set pieces in a franchise full of them.

Cast: Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman, Wolf Kahler
Synopsis: Indiana Jones (Harrison Ford) is no ordinary archeologist. When we first see him, he is somewhere in the Peruvian jungle...
Cnsensus: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.

Cast: Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn, Paul Reiser
Synopsis: Big-budget special effects, swiftly paced action, and a distinct feminist subtext from writer/director James Cameron turned what should have been...
Cnsensus: While Alien was a marvel of slow-building, atmospheric tension, Aliens packs a much more visceral punch, and features a typically strong performance from Sigourney Weaver.

Cast: Yun-Fat Chow, Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Anthony Wong, Teresa Mo
Synopsis: Yun-Fat portrays a maverick, clarinet-playing cop nicknamed "Tequila" whose partner is killed in the dizzying chaos of a restaurant gunfight...
Cnsensus: Boasting impactful action as well as surprising emotional resonance, Hard Boiled is a powerful thriller that hits hard in more ways than one.

Cast: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano
Synopsis: What if virtual reality wasn't just for fun, but was being used to imprison you? That's the dilemma that faces...
Cnsensus: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong, Robert Patrick
Synopsis: A sequel to the sci-fi action thriller that made him and star Arnold Schwarzenegger A-list Hollywood names, writer/director James Cameron...
Cnsensus: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman, Reginald VelJohnson, Bonnie Bedelia
Synopsis: It's Christmas time in L.A., and there's an employee party in progress on the 30th floor of the Nakatomi Corporation...
Cnsensus: Its many imitators (and sequels) have never come close to matching the taut thrills of the definitive holiday action classic.

Cast: Tom Hardy, Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley
Synopsis: Filmmaker George Miller gears up for another post-apocalyptic action adventure with Fury Road, the fourth outing in the Mad Max...
Cnsensus: With exhilarating action and a surprising amount of narrative heft, Mad Max: Fury Road brings George Miller's post-apocalyptic franchise roaring vigorously back to life.
